title: Plant-Pest Interactions
description: Plant biochemical and physical defenses to herbivorous insects, plant pathogens and weeds, and the evolutionary and genetic basis thereof, with particular focus on the master's thesis. Effects of environmental manipulations, and other cultural controls on pest populations, and the use of induced resistance materials. Not open to students with credit in PPSCÂ 421. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: BOT 323 or BOT 324, and PPSC 311 or ZOO 335, and graduate standing
